answers.answer: "i also do glucose test. this time mine was 103 after 12hrs of sleep."Fasting, right? You didn't get up to snack or drink colored liquids during your "12hrs of sleep" did you? That will skewer you test results.So, yes, 103 mg/dl is considered prediabetes but I wouldn't jump the gun on this result. Ask for an A1c test to verify the last test result. Why? Glucose testing test at the the time of test and can be off by ± [plus/minus] 20%. Yep, that's what the FDA [Food and Drug Administration] and ISO [International Standards Organization] allow. See this for an A1c explanation.http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/a1c-test/MY00142In the meantime read up on diabetes nutrition such as the Glycemic Index.

It stands for "Google Is Your Friend". Use Google to search for answers. On carbs, there are "good" carbs and there are "bad" carbs. Educate yourself on the differences.  A good start is the Glycemic Index.http://www.lowglycemicdiet.com/compareyourdiet.html .Proper nutrition is the key to good health. Proper nutrition means to accentuate the positive when it comes to food. I dislike the word diet. “Diet” implies a rigorous, self-sacrificial discipline that’s doomed to fail. Instead, focus on achieving food goals of what you should eat each day rather than what you shouldn’t eat.
